name: Andrew, Brent S.
employer: Speaking Plainly / University of San Francisco
title: Founder and Principal / Adjunct Professor of Communications and Public Relations
notes: Veteran communications strategist with more than 35 years of experience in healthcare, utilities, telecommunications, energy and nonprofits. Former Senior Vice President at Keadjian Associates, LLC and Manager of Executive Communications at AT&T.

name: Bass, James E.
employer: Ojai Goliad LLC (retired partner, Gibson Dunn & Crutcher)
title: Partner / Former Managing Partner (Hong Kong office, Gibson Dunn)
notes: Yale B.A. 1982, Stanford J.D. 1987. Was a partner at Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher LLP with experience in California and Hong Kong, including as Managing Partner of the Hong Kong office in the mid-1990s. Subsequently an Executive Director at FB Gemini Limited and Fubon Capital.
ngos: Trustee, Communities Foundation of Texas; Member, Board of Trustees, North Texas Regional Center of Innovation and Commercialization

name: Coleman, Lewis W.
title: President and CFO (retired)
notes: Spent 21 years at Wells Fargo and Bank of America (Vice Chairman and CFO), then was President and COO of Banc of America Securities. President of the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation from its founding (2000) to 2004. President and CFO of DreamWorks Animation SKG 2005-2017. Non-executive Chairman of Northrop Grumman 2010-2011.
ngos: Board, Conservation International; Member, National Academies Board on Science, Technology and Economic Policy; National Academy of Arts and Sciences Fellow; Board, Global Crop Diversity Trust; Board, Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation
political_donations: Democratic donor; $30,800 to DNC (2009); $35,800 to Obama Victory Fund 2012; $30,400 to DNC (2011)

name: Collins, Charles M.
employer: YMCA of San Francisco (President Emeritus) / University of San Francisco
title: President Emeritus YMCA of San Francisco / Presidential Fellow, Leo T. McCarthy Center
notes: Graduated Williams College (B.A.), MIT (M.S.), Harvard Law School (J.D.). Chaired WDG Ventures (real estate, 1983-2002), then served nearly two decades as President and CEO of the YMCA of San Francisco. Also Special Advisor for Youth and Climate Initiatives to the Secretary General of the World Alliance of YMCAs.
ngos: San Francisco Arts Commission (President); Board, SF Museum of Modern Art; Board, Commonwealth Club/World Affairs Council; Board, UCSF Center for Community Engagement
political_donations: Recurring small Democratic donations through ActBlue (2025); $100/month to DSCC

name: Conger, Harry M.
title: Chairman and CEO (retired)
notes: Colorado School of Mines 1955. Rose through ASARCO, Kaiser Steel, and Consolidation Coal before joining Homestake Mining in 1975. Elected President (1977), CEO (1978), and Chairman (1982) of Homestake Mining; stepped down as CEO 1995 and retired 1998. Past Chairman of the American Mining Congress.
ngos: Board of Trustees, California Institute of Technology (Caltech)

name: Conger, Harry M. IV
title: Independent Director, Newmont; former President and COO, Teck Resources; former President, Americas, Freeport-McMoRan
notes: Known as 'Red,' holds a B.S. in Mining Engineering from Colorado School of Mines. Spent 20 years at Phelps Dodge before joining Freeport-McMoRan (2007) as President of Americas. COO of Teck Resources (2020-2023). Joined Newmont board June 2024. Former Chairman, National Mining Association.
political_donations: Republican donor; $1,000 to NRCC (2026); $1,000 to NRSC (2025); donations via WinRed to Trump National Committee JFC and Kari Lake for Senate (2024)

name: Cropper, Thomas Albert
employer: California State University Maritime Academy (retired president)
title: 14th President (retired); Rear Admiral, USN (Ret.)
notes: Born 1959, Iowa State University B.A. 1981. Flew A-6 Intruder and F/A-18 Hornet in Navy; commanded Carrier Air Wing Eleven aboard USS Nimitz. Retired as Rear Admiral after 31-year career. Served as President of Cal Maritime 2012-2023.

name: Faulhaber, Charles
title: Professor Emeritus of Spanish; Former Director, Bancroft Library
notes: Ph.D. Yale 1969. Professor of Medieval Spanish Literature at UC Berkeley 1969-2011, serving as Director of the Bancroft Library from 1995 to 2011. Led $64 million renovation of the Bancroft Library. Elected foreign corresponding member of the Royal Spanish Academy for his work on the PhiloBiblon project.

name: Fitzgerald, Paul J. S. J.
title: 28th President (President Emeritus)
notes: Jesuit priest with B.A. from Santa Clara University (1980), M.Div. from Weston School of Theology, and Docteur es Lettres (PhD in Sociology of Religion) from the Sorbonne. Served as President of the University of San Francisco 2014-2022. Previously Senior Vice President for Academic Affairs at Fairfield University and Associate Dean at Santa Clara University.

name: Gilbert, Robert J.
title: Partner
notes: Insurance coverage litigator with more than 30 years of experience recovering insurance proceeds for policyholders in every major industry. Represents hundreds of clients in pre-loss counseling and post-loss resolution of complex insurance and contract disputes. Selected to Super Lawyers 2006-2025.

name: Gilless, J. Keith
title: Professor Emeritus; Former Dean, College of Natural Resources
notes: B.S. from Michigan State University, joint Ph.D. in Forestry and Agricultural Economics from University of Wisconsin-Madison. Faculty at UC Berkeley since 1983. Dean of the College of Natural Resources 2007-2018. Chaired the California Board of Forestry and Fire Protection 2013-2024.
ngos: California Board of Forestry and Fire Protection (Chair, 2013-2024); USDA Forest Research Advisory Council (two terms)
political_donations: Small Democratic donations via ActBlue: $47 to Harris for President (2024); $15 to Warnock for Georgia (2022); $6 to Schiff for Congress (2021)

name: Heinrich, Mark F. USN (Ret.)
title: Managing Partner; Rear Admiral, USN (Ret.)
notes: U.S. Naval Academy graduate 1979. Rose to Rear Admiral serving as 46th Chief of Supply Corps and Commander, Naval Supply Systems Command. After retirement from Navy (2013), led Microsoft's multi-billion-dollar Azure Cloud supply chain. Founded Oakleaf Technology providing enterprise software and consulting.
ngos: Board, Navy Federal Credit Union; Board, Longbow Advantage; Penn Mutual Center for Veterans Affairs; U.S. Navy Memorial Board
political_donations: Democratic donations: $500 to Michael Franken for Iowa (2021); smaller ActBlue earmarked contributions

name: Hynes, William M.
employer: Holy Names University / St. Norbert College (both retired)
title: Former President, Holy Names University; President Emeritus, St. Norbert College
notes: Doctorate and master's degree in history of Christian thought from University of Chicago; M.A. in Catholic theology from Marquette. President of St. Norbert College 2000-2008; President of Holy Names University (Oakland) 2010-2016. Died April 27, 2023 in Santa Rosa, CA.

name: Kuhn, Gary A.
title: Unknown
notes: Insufficient public biographical information found to identify this specific individual. Multiple Gary A. Kuhns exist in California public records.

name: Liano, Anthony D. Jr.
title: President
notes: Associated with SFCS Management, Inc. in San Francisco. Public records show association with multiple California companies. Limited biographical information available publicly.

name: Mayne, Stephen S.
title: Partner
notes: Brown University B.A. 1963, Georgetown University Law Center J.D. 1966 and LL.M. 1967. California Bar admitted 1971. Litigation attorney with practice spanning antitrust, securities, shareholder disputes, broker-dealers, fiduciaries, probate and trust, and real estate at Manatt Phelps in San Francisco.

name: McCabe, Eugene A.
title: Manager (retired)
notes: Eugene 'Gene' Allan McCabe (May 18, 1933 - November 3, 2025) was based in Tiburon, CA. Worked as a manager at Western Plumbing and Heating. Active in Bay Area clubs and organizations across the East Bay, San Francisco, and Marin County.

name: McCune, Allan A.
title: President (third-generation owner)
notes: Third-generation owner of McCune Audio/Video/Lighting, founded 1932 by his grandfather Harry McCune Sr. The company grew to be one of the oldest and largest AV rental and sound services in the U.S., with offices in San Francisco, Anaheim, and Monterey. Sold to Shepard Exposition Services in 2017.

name: McNellis, John E.
title: Co-Founder and Principal
notes: UC Berkeley graduate and Hastings College of the Law J.D. Co-founded McNellis Partners in 1982, specializing in grocery-anchored retail center development in Northern California. Author of Making it in Real Estate (ULI Press) and monthly columnist for the San Francisco Business Times.
ngos: Urban Land Institute (ULI Governor, Trustee, founding member Environmental Task Force); Outward Bound USA (former national board, advisory board); Rebuilding Together Peninsula (past board president)
political_donations: Democratic donor: $25,000 to Biden Victory Fund (2020); $5,000 to Anna Eshoo for Congress (2023); $3,300 to Friends of Simitian (2024)

name: McReynolds, David Francis Antl
title: Managing Partner
notes: Based in San Mateo, CA. MBA from University of Chicago Booth School of Business; B.S. from UC Santa Barbara. Nearly 30 years of experience in middle-market special situations investing, distressed debt, and private equity. Previously with Twin Haven Capital, Versa Capital, and American Capital.
ngos: Young Presidents' Organization (YPO) member; Past-President, Southern California Turnaround Management Association

name: Morrissey, Richard T.
title: Unknown
notes: Insufficient public biographical information found to identify this specific individual in California. A LinkedIn profile for a Richard Morrissey exists in the San Mateo, CA area.

name: Patton, E. Scott
title: Unknown
notes: Insufficient public biographical information found to identify this specific individual. Multiple California residents named Scott Patton exist, including a judge and various attorneys.

name: Peterson, John H.
title: Unknown
notes: Insufficient public biographical information found to identify this specific individual. The name is common and multiple California executives and attorneys share it.

name: Peterson, Stephen F.
title: Unknown
notes: Insufficient public biographical information found to identify this specific individual. Multiple California attorneys named Stephen/Steven Peterson exist.

name: Petkevich, J. Misha
title: Founder and Chief Investment Officer
notes: Born 1949, Minneapolis. Harvard B.A. 1973, Oxford University D.Phil. (Rhodes Scholar). U.S. Figure Skating Champion (1971) and Olympian (1968, 1972). Head of Healthcare Banking at Hambrecht & Quist (1983) and Robertson Stephens (1989-1998). Founded The Petkevich Group (1998-2005), then BladeRock Capital/V2M Capital. Independent director, CohBar Inc. (2019-present).
ngos: President and Chairman, United States Figure Skating Foundation; Former board, San Francisco Opera; Former advisory board, Gladstone Institute; Former foundation board, UCSF
political_donations: Donations to Democratic causes: $2,000 to PAC to the Future (1999-2001); $1,000 to Evan Bayh Committee (1996); $812 to IMPAC (1994)

name: Powers, Michael S.
title: Unknown
notes: Insufficient public biographical information found to identify this specific individual. Multiple California executives and attorneys with the name Michael Powers exist.

name: Richanbach, David S.
title: Founder and Owner
notes: Colorful global career in event production and marketing. Toured as a lighting designer with Fleetwood Mac, Rolling Stones, BeeGees, and others. First Manager of Event Marketing at Apple Computer (1986-1989). VP Marketing and Business Development at Willin and Waigand Productions (1989-1990). Founded Richanbach and Associates in 1990 in Burlingame, CA.

name: Schreck, Thomas A.
title: Co-Founder and Vice Chairman / CEO
notes: Williams College B.A. 1979. Co-founder and founding CFO/President of DURECT Corporation (1998); Co-founder, Chairman and CEO of AcelRx Pharmaceuticals (raised over $60M, led to IPO); Co-founder and CEO of SinuSys Corp. Appointed to board of Ekso Bionics 2018. Based in Palo Alto, CA.

name: Sibley, Peter E.
employer: Cooper, White & Cooper LLP (now Womble Bond Dickinson)
title: Partner
notes: UC Hastings College of the Law graduate; California Bar admitted 1971. Construction litigation and insurance coverage attorney at Cooper, White & Cooper LLP in San Francisco for decades. Recognized as a top-rated construction litigation attorney by Super Lawyers.

name: Singer, Sam
title: Founder and President
notes: Raised in Berkeley, CA. Former newspaper reporter and TV/radio correspondent (Medill News Service/CBS). Founded Singer Associates in 2000, a San Francisco crisis communications firm with clients including ChevronTexaco, Calpine, San Francisco 49ers, Nike, Walmart, Bank of America, and many others.
political_donations: Democratic donor; 2025 FEC records show $100 to ActBlue earmarked for Midwest Values PAC and additional small contributions

name: Smith, Christopher J.
title: Unknown
notes: Insufficient public biographical information found to identify this specific individual in the context of the Isle of Aves camp. Multiple California executives and attorneys share this name.

name: Sproul, Robert Gordon III
title: Unknown
notes: Likely a descendant of Robert Gordon Sproul (1891-1975), the 11th President of the University of California who served 1930-1958 and is a legendary figure in California higher education. A LinkedIn profile for a Robert Sproul connected to UC Berkeley (Director of Stewardship and Scholarships, Cal Alumni Association) may be this individual.

name: Stoney, Carl J. Jr.
title: Attorney (Partner, Capital Markets), retired
notes: B.S. UC Berkeley 1967, M.B.A. UC Berkeley 1971, J.D. UC Berkeley (Boalt Hall). California Bar admitted 1971 (#49807). Capital markets attorney at Reed Smith LLP in San Francisco and Orinda. Serves on the UC Berkeley Foundation Board of Trustees.
ngos: UC Berkeley Foundation Board of Trustees
political_donations: Mixed donations: Republican support for Campbell for US Senate (2010); Democratic support for Joe Torsella for Congress (2003); Reed Smith PAC contributions

name: Szeri, Andrew
title: Provost and Vice-President Academic
notes: Mechanical engineer; joined UC Berkeley faculty 1997, becoming full professor 2003. Served as Dean of the Graduate Division at UC Berkeley 2007-2014, then as Vice Provost for Strategic Academic and Facilities Planning. Became Provost and Vice-President Academic at UBC in 2017.

name: Watt, Philip Cargill
title: Unknown
notes: Insufficient public biographical information found to identify this specific individual. The name Philip Cargill Watt does not appear in major public databases; the middle name Cargill appears to be a family name rather than a reference to Cargill Inc.
